types.name: CreateQuoteInput

inputFields.name: extras
inputFields.description: Optional miscellaneous information with regards to the quote

inputFields.name: issue
inputFields.description: Optional (journal, textbook, magazine etc.) issue number

inputFields.name: pageEnd
inputFields.description: Optional end of page where quote is located

inputFields.name: pageStart
inputFields.description: Optional start of page where quote is located

inputFields.name: tags
inputFields.description: The tags i.e subject matters of the quote

inputFields.name: volume
inputFields.description: Optional (journal, textbook, magazine etc.) volume number

types.description: Inputs for creating a Quote object

types.name: CreateSourceInput

inputFields.name: authorMaps
inputFields.description:
The original owners of the work - Either author creation inputs
    or list of author IDs mandatory

inputFields.name: publication
inputFields.description: For which conference was this work published - optional

inputFields.name: sourceTypeId
inputFields.description: The source type i.e. book, journal etc. - mandatory

inputFields.name: topic
inputFields.description: The topic of the work, as given by authour - manadatory

inputFields.name: url
inputFields.description: The URI where author's original work can be accessed - optional

inputFields.name: year
inputFields.description: The year the source was published

types.description: Inputs for creating a source with authors

types.name: Date
types.description:
The `Date` scalar type represents a date. The Date appears in a JSON
response as an ISO8601 formatted string.

types.name: GetQuotes
types.description: Inputs for querying list of quotes

types.name: ID
types.description:
The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to
refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON
response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer
(such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description:
The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values.
Int can represent values between `-(2^53 - 1)` and `2^53 - 1` since it is
represented in JSON as double-precision floating point numbers specified
by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

fields.name: quoteFullSearch
fields.description:
Specify any text to get queries or tags, or sources or
    source types matching the text

fields.name: quotes
fields.description: Query list of quotes - everything, or filter by source

types.name: QuoteFullSearchInput
types.description:
Input for full text search on quotes, their sources, tags and source
   types

types.name: QuoteFullSearchResult

fields.name: authors
fields.description: A search result from authors table

fields.name: quotes
fields.description: A search result from quotes table

fields.name: sourceTypes
fields.description: A search result from source types table

fields.name: sources
fields.description: A search result from sources table

fields.name: tags
fields.description: A search result from tags table

types.description: Result returned when we search quotes by text

types.name: QuoteFullSearchResultRow

fields.name: column
fields.description: The column name of the table from which the search was obtained

fields.name: source
fields.description: The table name from which the sarch was obtained

fields.name: tid
fields.description: The ID of the row from which the search was obtained

types.description: Result row returned when we search quotes by text

types.name: QuoteFullSearchTable
types.description:
When we do full text search, the result returned will contain name of
  the table from which the result was returned. This object contains an
  enum of the possible table names

types.name: String
types.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: onField
fields.deprecationReason: Check `locations` field for enum value FIELD

fields.name: onFragment
fields.deprecationReason: Check `locations` field for enum value FRAGMENT_SPREAD

fields.name: onOperation
fields.deprecationReason: Check `locations` field for enum value OPERATION

types.name: __Type
types.description: Represents scalars, interfaces, object types, unions, enums in the system

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true."

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
